text: Write code like the maintainer would be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: Steve McConnell

text: The complexity of the program grows until it exceeds the ability of the programmer.
author: Arthur Bloch. Murphy's laws

text: It's very easy to walk on water and develop programs according to the ToR... if they are frozen.
author: I. Berard

text: In theory, theory and practice are inseparable. In practice, this is not the case.
author: Yoggi Berra

text: Programs must be written for the people who will read them, and the machines that will execute these programs are secondary.
author: Harold Abelson

text: Debugging code is like hunting. Hunting for bugs.
author: Amit Kalantri

text: If you give a person a program, you will keep him busy for one day. If you teach a person to program, you will keep him busy for life.
author: Waseem Latif

text: Programming is about breaking something big and impossible into something small and quite real.
author: Jazzwant

text: Premature optimization is the root of all evil.
author: Donald Knuth
